title.native: ぼくたちは勉強ができない

description:
His late father always said that a useless man should strive to be useful, so to that end, third-year high school student Nariyuki Yuiga dedicated himself to becoming a high-achieving student in his school, despite his history of poor grades. In order to give his destitute family a better life, his ultimate goal is to obtain the special VIP nomination, a prestigious scholarship covering all future university tuition fees. Although Nariyuki could feasibly be a shoe-in for the nomination, he is constantly overshadowed by classmates Rizu Ogata and Fumino Furuhashi in mathematics and literature, respectively.

To his delight, Nariyuki receives the nomination, but there’s a catch: he has to tutor his two star classmates, who are each hopelessly mediocre at the other’s subject of expertise! To make matters worse, the subjects they are horrible at are the same subjects they want to pursue for their future. As the time to submit university applications draws nearer, Nariyuki must find an effective tutoring method for the girls before it’s too late.

(Source: Official Website)
synonyms: เรื่องนี้ตําราไม่มีสอน

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Swimming
tags.description: Centers around the sport of swimming.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description: Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003558003913)__

__Residency:__ Fujisawa, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kugenuma High School, Yoyogi Animation Academy

__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tastufumi_Itoh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤達文)

While still in Morioka, he and three of his friends produced a short anime film titled Bakuhatsu Choujin Kanada Man (爆発超人・金田マン), which was inspired by renown animator [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/). The film was screened at an amateur film festival in 1985 and subsequently featured in the anime magazine Animage.

In 2008, he married fellow animator [Mariko Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/120064/), and changed his name to Itou.

Passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/).

He is known for his sense of timing, which gives his animation often a stop-motion like feeling. He studied as an animator under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/), under whom he often worked on productions like [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/) or [You're Under Arrest](https://anilist.co/anime/1372/). He does also team up often with animator [Hirofumi Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101188/), who has influenced Matsutake's animation.

Aside of working on anime he has also worked on several games, mostly the Tales of series, where he served as animation supervisor on the animated sequences in most of the series' games.

Also close friends with [Atsushi Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/105805/), [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/).
__Toshiyuki Sone__ is a Japanese episode director.

**Birthplace:** Matsumoto City, Nagano Prefecture, Japan

**Yasunori Ide** is a Japanese director, script/screenwriter, supervisor, animation planner, episode director and storyboard artist. He is also a lyricist, and has contributed with lyrics to multiple anime songs in the early to late 2000s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tastufumi_Itoh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤達文)

While still in Morioka, he and three of his friends produced a short anime film titled Bakuhatsu Choujin Kanada Man (爆発超人・金田マン), which was inspired by renown animator [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/). The film was screened at an amateur film festival in 1985 and subsequently featured in the anime magazine Animage.

In 2008, he married fellow animator [Mariko Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/120064/), and changed his name to Itou.

Passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
__Toshiyuki Sone__ is a Japanese episode director.

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/)'s paint department.

Making the most of his origin, he sometimes works a color designer because of this.
